link.Abstract: Earlier this week, an old man with a heavily starched collar and powdered hair was interviewed about the headlines of the day by a free daily commuter paper. Among other things, he said that Greeks and Italians have disgusting habits, and that Russian men are ugly. He also said that while British singer Adele "has a beautiful face and a divine voice," she's "a little too fat."
link.title: Nathalie Atkinson on Karl Lagerfeld's Fat Flap

content.div:
Say you win six Grammys in a single evening, bring the world to tears (again) with a note-perfect comeback performance and then charm the snot out of every last one of your fans with your acceptance speech. If you're Adele, whatever do you do next?

The 21 singer's Vogue cover story seemed to hold the answer: "I am f*cking off four four or five years," said the 23-year-old, explaining she wants to cool her career and focus on building a relationship with boyfriend Simon Konecki, 36. "So at least now I can have enough time to write a happy record," she continued. "And then I don't know what I'll do. Get married. Have some kids. Plant a nice vegetable patch."

Shenanigans.

And Adele confirmed as much -- excellent news for anyone who's been tear-staining their copy of Vogue, bawling harder than the first time you heard "Someone Like You.” She might not be mounting a world tour any time soon, but she's certainly not enjoying Freedom 23.

The singer's management refuted Vogue’s report of early retirement, telling the BBC that Adele’s quote in the magazine was "just an offhand comment." And a blog post written by Adele herself suggests she's still very much on the clock.

"I've a few days off now, and then it's the Brit Awards here at home and then I'm straight into the studio. BOYYAHH! 5 years? More like 5 days!" she wrote.

As the blog mentions, Adele is booked to play the BRIT Awards Feb. 21. Like her Grammy performance Sunday, her appearance at the UK award show is among her first since undergoing vocal cord surgery, and though reports -- and her Grammy performance -- suggest she's made a full recovery, if Adele seems to be freeing enough time in her schedule to tend to her veggie patch, go couples fan-boating, etc., it may be for the sake of those inimitable pipes.

In a 60 Minutes interview Sunday, Adele told Anderson Cooper that she's become more cautious about how she treats her voice since a polyp appeared on her vocal cords last year. "If I decide to go on a 200-date world tour, it would happen again," she said during the Q&A -- and her manager, Jonathan Dickins, seems to be approaching tour plans with caution.

"We have to ease her back," he told Billboard, discussing the possibility of future concert dates. According to the outlet, plans for 2012 have not yet been discussed. "While she's fully recovered, like any injury you need to build your strength back up. I'm mindful of that. I'm gonna let her enjoy this moment and not drive her mad. We'll sit down and work out what we're doing going forward. ... We all believe that she's an artist who will be around for a long time. There's absolutely no short-term approach to her recovery."

Even without a world tour, Adele continues to be the Queen of the charts. 21, the highest-selling album of 2011, continues to hold Billboard's No. 1 spot, and as of this week, it tied Whitney Houston's The Bodyguard soundtrack and Elvis Presley's Blue Hawaii for 20 weeks at the top.

leahc@dose.ca

entry.title: 2012 Grammy Awards - Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: It's music's biggest -- and longest -- night. Adele, Foo Fighters, Whitney Houston and more made for some of the most memorable moments of the 54th Annual Grammy Awards.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. Typically, though, they're in the audience -- collecting more trophies than their Versace-clad arms can carry. That was certainly true of Sunday's edition -- with the likes of Adele, Kanye West and the Foo Fighters being lauded. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evening, but that didn't stop the 54th Annual Grammy Awards from being the marathon, three and a half hour party it always is. Check out some of the highlights.
--Leah Collins/Dose.ca

link.Abstract: Earlier this week, an old man with a heavily starched collar and powdered hair was interviewed about the headlines of the day by a free daily commuter paper. Among other things, he said that Greeks and Italians have disgusting habits, and that Russian men are ugly. He also said that while British singer Adele "has a beautiful face and a divine voice," she's "a little too fat."

link.Abstract: Since 2003, Chanel has launched an annual Métiers d'Art collection in addition to its prêt-à-porter and Haute Couture collections. Check out images from the runway in Paris, France as head designer and creative director Karl Lagerfeld presents this year's 'Paris-Bombay' collection, which was inspired by India.
link.title: Photos: Chanel -- Pre-Fall 2012 Collection

link.Abstract: Karl Lagerfeld showed his Spring 2012 collection for French fashion house Chanel during Paris Fashion Week. The runway was transformed into an undersea kingdom and the show featured a performance by Florence Welch of Florence and the Machine.
link.title: Photos: Chanel -- Paris Fashion Week Spring 2012

entry.content: Earlier this week, an old man with a heavily starched collar and powdered hair was interviewed about the headlines of the day by a free daily commuter paper. Among other things, he said that Greeks and Italians have disgusting habits, and that Russian men are ugly. He also said that while British singer Adele "has a beautiful face and a divine voice," she's "a little too fat."

source.title: Adele Back in Studio (So Much For All That Early Retirement Talk in Vogue)
source.subtitle: Stop crying over Adele's Vogue story like you just listened to "Someone Like You." The singer's not really taking five years off.
